## arrayNormalizeNullishToEmpty() function

Replaces `null` / `undefined` with an empty `Array`<!-- -->.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function arrayNormalizeNullishToEmpty<TItem>(array: TItem[] | null | undefined): TItem[];
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  array | TItem\[\] \| null \| undefined |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

TItem\[\]

`array` if it's an `Array` of length greater than 0, otherwise an empty `Array`<!-- -->.

See [arrayNormalizeNullishToEmpty()](./rc-js-util.arraynormalizenullishtoempty.md)<!-- -->.
